snippet: Investigators are examining allegations that Dominique Strauss-Kahn was involved in an assault at a Washington hotel in 2010, a spokesman at the prosecutor’s office in Lille said on Friday.
abstract: French prosecutors seek to widen investigation of Dominique Strauss-Kahn, former International Monetary Fund chief, to look into accusations that he sexually assaulted a woman at a Washington hotel in 2010; Strauss-Kahn's lawyers denounce accusations, noting they come two days before hotly contested runoff vote for the French presidency.

byline.original: By DOREEN CARVAJAL and MAÏA de la BAUME
byline.contributor: John H. Cushman Jr. and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Investigators are examining allegations that Dominique Strauss-Kahn was involved in an assault at a Washington hotel in 2010, a spokesman at the prosecutor’s office in Lille said on Friday.

headline.seo: Dominique Strauss-Kahn Faces New Sexual Assault Allegations
headline.main: Strauss-Kahn Faces Allegations of Sexually Assaulting Woman at a Hotel in Washington
headline.print_headline: Strauss-Kahn Faces Allegations of Sexually Assaulting Woman at a Hotel in Washington
